overview: Jobseeker’s Allowance (JSA) - including contribution-based JSA, income-based JSA, who is eligible, what you get and how to claim
title: Jobseeker's Allowance

table.body:
Jobseeker’s Allowance (JSA) is paid if you're:

- looking and available for work 
- aged 18 or over but below State Pension age 
- working less than 16 hours per week on average 
- in Great Britain


^Jobseeker's Allowance isn't normally paid to 16 or 17 year olds, except in special cases. You can get advice from your  [local Jobcentre Plus office.](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Find your local Jobcentre Plus office"){:rel="external"}

There are 2 types of JSA:


##Contribution-based Jobseeker's Allowance##

You may get contribution-based Jobseeker's Allowance if you've paid enough [National Insurance](/national-insurance "National Insurance") contributions (NICs). Jobcentre Plus can pay this for up to 182 days. Generally, self-employed contributions will not help you qualify for contribution-based Jobseeker’s Allowance.


##Income-based Jobseeker's Allowance##

This is based on your income and savings. You may get this if you've not paid enough NICs (or you've only paid contributions for self-employment) and you're on a low income.


*[NICs]: National Insurance Contributions


*[JSA]: Jobseeker's Allowance
table.title: Overview

table.body:
^When you apply for Jobseeker’s Allowance (JSA), Jobcentre Plus will work out which type of JSA you should be paid.^

##Contribution-based JSA##

Age | Amount
- | -
Aged 16 - 24 | £53.45
Aged 25 or over | £67.50

^ For contribution-based JSA, the amount you get may be less if you have any earnings from part-time work or any pension payments ^

##Income-based JSA##

Type of person | Amount
 - | -
Single people (under 25) | £53.45
Single people (25 or over) | £67.50
Couples and civil partnerships (both aged 18 or over) | £105.95 
Lone parent (under 18) | £53.45 
Lone parent (18 or over) | £67.50

^ For income-based JSA, the amount you get may be less after your household income, pension and any savings of £6,000 or more are taken into account. ^

##JSA payments##

In most cases you won't get any money for the first 3 days of your claim.  JSA is paid at the end of every fortnight.

All benefits, pensions and allowances are paid into an account, eg your bank account.


*[JSA]: Jobseeker's Allowance
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
To get Jobseeker's Allowance (JSA) you must be:

* looking for and available for work 
* aged 18 or over but below State Pension age 
* working less than 16 hours per week on average 
* in Great Britain

^Jobseeker's Allowance isn't normally paid to 16 or 17 year olds, except in special cases. You can get advice from your  [local Jobcentre Plus office.](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Find your local Jobcentre Plus office"){:rel="external"}

##State Pension age##

If you're a man aged 60 to 64, you might be able to claim [Pension Credit](/pension-credit "Pension Credit") instead of JSA. 



*[JSA]: Jobseeker's Allowance
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
##Claim online##
You can [claim online](https://www.dwpe-services.direct.gov.uk/en/jobseekersallowanceclaim "Claim Jobseeker's Allowance online"){:rel="external"}
or call Jobcentre Plus. 

$C
**Jobcentre Plus**
                     
**Telephone:** 0800 055 6688                  
**Welsh language line:** 0800 012 1888     
**Textphone:** 0800 023 4888
       
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm.

$C






*[JSA]: Jobseeker's Allowance
table.title: How to claim

table.body:
##If your circumstances change or you start work

Tell [Jobcentre Plus](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=2&lang=en "contact Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"} if your circumstances change, eg you move home or your bank details change.

You must also tell Jobcentre Plus about any work you do when you're getting Jobseeker's Allowance (JSA).

##If you’re unhappy with the decision##

If you're refused JSA or if you have any queries about your payment, contact Jobcentre Plus and ask for an explanation. If you're unhappy with the decision you can appeal.

$C
**Jobcentre Plus**
                     
**Telephone:** 0800 055 6688                  
**Welsh language line:** 0800 012 1888     
**Textphone:** 0800 023 4888
       
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm.

$C







*[JSA]: Jobseeker's Allowance
